definitions: part of a road intended for vehicles, especially the paved section
examples: The dual carriageway was blocked by an overturned truck
Workers resurfaced the northbound carriageway over the weekend

definitions: company or vehicle that transports goods or passengers commercially
person or animal that harbors disease organisms without showing symptoms
wave or signal that carries modulated information in telecommunications
frame, bag, or device designed to hold and transport items
examples: The carrier delivered our packages right on schedule
Several airlines operate as budget carriers in Europe
The mosquito acts as a carrier for malaria parasites
She was an asymptomatic carrier of the virus
The radio carrier frequency was set to 101.5 MHz
Engineers adjusted the carrier signal for better transmission
She placed the baby in the carrier before shopping
The roof carrier held our camping equipment securely

definitions: decaying flesh of dead animals, typically eaten by scavengers
examples: Vultures circled above the carrion in the desert
The smell of carrion attracted flies and beetles

definitions: orange root vegetable commonly eaten raw or cooked
reward or incentive offered to motivate someone to do something
examples: She added diced carrots to the vegetable soup
Rabbits love eating fresh carrots from the garden
The bonus served as a carrot to boost productivity
They used tax breaks as a carrot for investors

definitions: the act or manner of transporting something from one place to another
the distance a ball or projectile travels through the air
examples: The carry of heavy equipment required special vehicles
Her graceful carry of the water jars impressed everyone
The golf ball had excellent carry over the water hazard
Wind conditions affected the carry of the baseball

definitions: vehicle with wheels used for transporting goods, often pulled by hand or animal
wheeled basket or frame used for carrying items while shopping
examples: The farmer loaded hay onto the wooden cart
Street vendors sold fruit from colorful carts
She filled her shopping cart with groceries
The cart's wheel was stuck in the store aisle

definitions: association of manufacturers or suppliers formed to maintain prices and restrict competition
criminal organization involved in drug trafficking and organized crime
examples: The oil cartel controlled production to influence prices
Government regulators investigated the alleged price-fixing cartel
Police arrested members of the notorious drug cartel
The cartel controlled trafficking routes across the border

definitions: firm, flexible connective tissue found in joints and other body structures
examples: The surgeon repaired torn cartilage in her knee
Sharks have skeletons made entirely of cartilage

definitions: person who draws or produces maps professionally
examples: The cartographer carefully plotted the new territorial boundaries
Medieval cartographers often included mythical creatures on maps

definitions: the science or art of drawing maps and charts
examples: She studied cartography at the university's geography department
Digital cartography has revolutionized how we create maps

definitions: box or container made of cardboard or similar material
container specifically designed for liquids like milk or juice
examples: The eggs came in a recyclable cardboard carton
She packed her belongings in several moving cartons
He drank orange juice straight from the carton
The milk carton displayed the expiration date clearly

definitions: animated television show or film, typically aimed at children
humorous or satirical drawing in a newspaper or magazine
examples: The children watched Saturday morning cartoons together
The new cartoon series features talking animals
The political cartoon criticized the government's new policy
The newspaper's editorial cartoon won a journalism award

definitions: artist who creates cartoons for publication or animation
examples: The cartoonist drew daily comic strips for newspapers
Walt Disney was a famous cartoonist and animator

definitions: container holding a bullet, gunpowder, and primer for firearms
replaceable container holding ink for printers or pens
removable device containing software or data for gaming systems
examples: The hunter loaded fresh cartridges into his rifle
Police found spent cartridges at the crime scene
The printer needs a new ink cartridge to continue
She replaced the toner cartridge in the laser printer
He inserted the game cartridge into the console
Vintage game cartridges have become valuable collectibles

definitions: acrobatic movement where the body rotates sideways with arms and legs extended
wheel with spokes radiating from the center, or its decorative representation
examples: The gymnast performed three perfect cartwheels in succession
Children practiced cartwheels on the playground grass
The wagon's wooden cartwheel needed urgent repair
The garden featured a decorative cartwheel against the fence

definitions: person who cuts or shapes materials, especially wood or stone
large knife specifically designed for slicing cooked meat
examples: The wood carver created intricate figurines from oak
Stone carvers restored the cathedral's damaged sculptures
He used the carver to slice the Thanksgiving turkey
The carving set included a carver and serving fork

definitions: decorative object or design created by cutting into material
the activity or art of cutting shapes from materials
examples: The ancient carving depicted scenes from mythology
Intricate carvings adorned the temple's wooden doors
Ice carving requires special tools and techniques
She took up wood carving as a retirement hobby

definitions: steep waterfall or series of small waterfalls
succession of events or things happening quickly one after another
examples: The cascade tumbled down the rocky mountainside beautifully
Tourists photographed the spectacular cascade in the national park
The bank failure triggered a cascade of financial collapses
Her resignation caused a cascade of management changes

definitions: container or protective covering for storing or transporting items
legal action or matter being considered by a court
particular instance or example of something occurring
form of a noun or pronoun showing its grammatical function
examples: She packed her violin in its protective case
The phone case prevented damage from the fall
The lawyer presented compelling evidence in the murder case
The Supreme Court will hear the case next month
This is a clear case of mistaken identity
In most cases, the treatment proves effective
Latin nouns change form depending on their grammatical case
The accusative case marks the direct object

definitions: money in the form of coins or banknotes rather than checks or credit
immediate payment at the time of purchase or transaction
examples: She withdrew cash from the ATM for shopping
The store only accepts cash, no credit cards
They offered a discount for cash payment upfront
The deal required cash on delivery

definitions: secure box for storing cash, typically with compartments for different denominations
examples: The vendor locked the cashbox after counting receipts
Someone stole the cashbox from the ticket booth

definitions: kidney-shaped nut from a tropical tree, commonly eaten roasted or salted
examples: She added cashews to the stir-fry for extra crunch
Roasted cashews make a healthy afternoon snack

definitions: person who handles payments and receipts in a store or bank
examples: The cashier scanned all items before processing payment
Bank cashiers must be accurate when counting money

definitions: fine soft wool obtained from Kashmir goats, or fabric made from it
examples: Her cashmere sweater felt incredibly soft and warm
Genuine cashmere commands high prices in fashion markets

definitions: protective outer cover or shell of something, especially machinery or ammunition
membrane or synthetic material used to enclose sausage meat
examples: The metal casing protected the delicate electronic components
Investigators found bullet casings at the crime scene
The butcher stuffed the mixture into natural sausage casings
Synthetic casings are often used for hot dogs

definitions: building or room where gambling games are played for money
examples: The casino offered poker, blackjack, and slot machines
Las Vegas casinos attract millions of tourists annually

definitions: large wooden barrel used for storing liquids, especially alcoholic drinks
examples: The whiskey aged for twelve years in oak casks
Wine casks lined the walls of the ancient cellar

definitions: box in which a corpse is buried or cremated
small ornamental box for holding jewelry or other valuables
examples: The casket was lowered slowly into the grave
They chose a simple wooden casket for the burial
She kept her grandmother's rings in an antique casket
The jeweled casket contained precious family heirlooms

definitions: starchy tuberous root of a tropical plant, used as food staple
examples: Cassava flour is gluten-free and widely used in baking
Many African countries rely on cassava as a staple crop

definitions: food cooked slowly in an oven in a covered dish
large deep dish used both for cooking and serving
examples: She prepared a chicken casserole for the potluck dinner
The casserole bubbled appetizingly in the oven
The ceramic casserole dish could go from oven to table
She bought a new casserole with a tight-fitting lid

definitions: sealed plastic unit containing magnetic tape for audio or video recording
container holding film or other material in a camera or device
examples: She found old music cassettes in the attic
The cassette player ate her favorite mix tape
The X-ray technician inserted a new film cassette
The tape cassette mechanism needed cleaning

definitions: all the actors appearing in a play, film, or show
rigid casing used to immobilize and protect broken bones
the act of throwing a fishing line or net
object made by shaping material in a mold
examples: The cast received standing ovations on opening night
Directors assembled an all-star cast for the blockbuster
The doctor applied a cast to her broken ankle
He signed his friend's colorful arm cast
His cast reached the middle of the river
The fisherman made a perfect cast toward the rocks
The bronze cast captured every detail of the sculpture
Archaeologists made plaster casts of the footprints

definitions: person stranded in an isolated place, especially after a shipwreck
examples: The castaway survived on the island for three years
Rescue teams searched for castaways after the yacht sank

definitions: hereditary social class system, especially in Hindu society, or any rigid social stratification
examples: The caste system traditionally determined occupation and social status
Social mobility between castes was historically restricted

definitions: small wheel on a swivel attached to furniture for easy movement
container with perforations for sprinkling sugar or condiments
examples: The chair's caster broke, making it difficult to roll
Heavy-duty casters allowed the cabinet to move easily
She passed the sugar caster around the tea table
The silver caster set included salt and pepper shakers

definitions: process of selecting actors for roles in a production
process of shaping metal or other material by pouring into molds
technique of throwing a fishing line into water
examples: The casting director auditioned hundreds of actors
Open casting calls attracted aspiring performers
The foundry specialized in bronze casting techniques
Precision casting produced complex engine components
He practiced his fly casting at the river
Distance casting requires proper technique and timing

definitions: large fortified building or complex from medieval times, typically a royal residence
chess piece that can move any number of squares horizontally or vertically
examples: The medieval castle overlooked the entire valley below
Tourists explored the castle's dungeons and towers
She moved her castle to protect the king
In chess, the castle is also called a rook

definitions: surgical removal of the testicles or ovaries, or the state resulting from this
examples: Veterinarians recommend castration to control pet populations
The procedure involved chemical castration rather than surgery

definitions: person killed or injured in war or accident
person or thing badly affected by an event or situation
examples: The hospital treated casualties from the train derailment
War casualties numbered in the thousands
Small businesses became casualties of the economic downturn
Truth is often the first casualty of war

definitions: small domesticated carnivorous mammal kept as a pet
any wild animal of the cat family, including lions and tigers
examples: The cat purred contentedly on her owner's lap
Stray cats gathered behind the restaurant each evening
Big cats like jaguars inhabit the rainforest
Wild cats are skilled nocturnal hunters

definitions: violent upheaval or disaster that causes great destruction or fundamental change
examples: The asteroid impact was a cataclysm that ended the dinosaurs
Economic cataclysm followed the stock market crash

definitions: underground cemetery consisting of tunnels with recesses for tombs
examples: Tourists explored the ancient catacombs beneath Rome
The catacombs contained thousands of burial niches

definitions: systematic list of items, typically in alphabetical or other order
publication containing details and often photographs of items for sale
examples: The library's catalog includes millions of book titles
Scientists created a catalog of newly discovered species
She browsed the furniture catalog for bedroom ideas
The seed catalog arrived just before planting season

definitions: systematic list of items, typically in alphabetical or other order
publication containing details and often photographs of items for sale
examples: The museum's catalogue documented every artifact
Researchers compiled a catalogue of medieval manuscripts
The fashion catalogue featured the latest spring collection
Universities send course catalogues to prospective students

definitions: substance that increases the rate of chemical reaction without being consumed
person or thing that precipitates an event or change
examples: Platinum acts as a catalyst in many industrial processes
The enzyme serves as a biological catalyst
Her speech became a catalyst for social reform
The scandal was the catalyst that toppled the government

definitions: sailing or motor vessel with two parallel hulls of equal size
examples: The catamaran sailed smoothly through rough seas
Racing catamarans can reach incredible speeds

definitions: ancient military weapon for hurling large stones or projectiles
device or mechanism for launching objects forcefully into the air
examples: Medieval armies used catapults to breach castle walls
The museum displayed a working replica of a Roman catapult
The aircraft carrier's catapult launched jets into flight
Children built a small catapult for their science project

definitions: medical condition causing clouding of the eye's lens, leading to decreased vision
large, powerful waterfall or violent rush of water
examples: The surgeon successfully removed cataracts from both eyes
Cataracts develop gradually and are common in elderly patients
The boat approached the dangerous cataract cautiously
Massive cataracts thundered down the cliff face

definitions: sudden event causing great damage, suffering, or dramatic change in fortune
examples: The earthquake was a catastrophe that left thousands homeless
Environmental catastrophe threatens the entire ecosystem

definitions: Islamic state led by a caliph as political and religious successor to Muhammad
examples: The Ottoman caliphate lasted for over six centuries
Historians studied the rise and fall of various caliphates
